thread.title: This week's top Birmingham playmaker rarely leaves the football field
thread.title_full: This week's top Birmingham playmaker rarely leaves the football field

title: This week's top Birmingham playmaker rarely leaves the football field
text:
Ahmad Isaac rarely leaves the football field on Friday nights. 
Isaac plays quarterback, safety, kick returner and punt returner for the Midfield Patriots . 
“Playing on both sides isn’t very easy but our school is small so we condition very well during the week,” he said. 
So much so that Isaac found a way last Friday to lead Midfield to a 47-15 win against B.B. Comer , while earning AL.com Player of the Week honors in Birmingham. He rushed for 166 yards and a touchdown, threw two TD passes and had two fumble recoveries. 
"Ahmad just has a strong will to win," said his coach, Rod Isaac. "Whatever it takes, he's willing to do - running, catching, throwing, blocking. He was just having fun (last week) competing and getting all his teammates involved. He is such an unselfish competitor. It's always special to see teammates play for each other." 
Ahmad Isaac's Week 9 effort led to one of the biggest voting frenzies of the season , Isaac finished with 18,005 votes, compiled online from AL.com readers, to outdistance Thompson quarterback Walker Lott and his 338 all-purpose effort in a win against Tuscaloosa County . Lott compiled 10,616 votes. 
Grayson Cash , Hewitt-Trussville’s dynamic, two-way letterman, filled in for injured running back Jarrion Street in an effort which earned him third place with 3,927 votes. 
Not that it’s always this season for Isaac, listed at six feet, 160 lbs. 
“Usually close to the fourth quarter is when we normally get winded, but we have to fight through it,” he said. 
On Friday, Midfield (5-3, 4-1) plays Fultondale (4-4, 3-2) in Class 3A, Region 3 action. 
Week 9 Birmingham Player of the Week 
Total votes: 34,246
